capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's lineage is a bit of a mix between being a pure-blood wizard and having some magical heritage from his mother. I'm quite certain about this, it's not something that's widely disputed among the wizarding community. Overall, I'd say it's a pretty interesting aspect of his background, and it adds to the complexity of his story.
capsules_submitted.reply: i did not know that! i've never heard of a mixed wizard before, valeria, can you tell me more about what that is?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complicated lineage. He's actually the son of Tobias Snape and Eileen Prince, but his father is also the brother of Ariana Dumbledore - that's right, Ariana, the sister of Harry Potter! It's all really interesting to learn about, especially since it shows how Snape's family ties are connected to the wizarding world in such a big way.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. how old was snape?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed an adult, and I've had my fair share of dealing with him in the Hogwarts years. He's a complex character, to say the least.
capsules_submitted.reply: i did not know that! i've never met an adult before, this is really interesting!

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that the character Filch from Harry Potter is considered an adult. That's confirmed by most sources, and I'm certain about it. It makes sense, given his role as a caretaker at Hogwarts and his somewhat gruff demeanor.
capsules_submitted.reply: incredible so, filch is also an adult, just like professor snape.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is an adult, and I have to admit, his age has played a significant role in shaping the way he interacts with others, especially Harry Potter. The fact that he's been around for so long has given him a certain level of authority and wisdom, but it's also made him somewhat...prickly.
capsules_submitted.reply: that rings a bell. valeria mentioned that snape is an adult.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've noticed that the character of Filch in our school's stories is often portrayed as being quite strict and uptight. He's always on the lookout for any kind of misbehavior or rule-breaking, which can be pretty intimidating to students like us. But at the same time, I think he's just trying to do his job to the best of his ability, even if it means coming across as a bit harsh sometimes.
